name: Native Tongue
description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

key_work.title: Native Tongue – Mo’Ju
key_work.credit_line: ℗ 2018 Mojo Juju, exclusively licensed to Australian Broadcasting Corporation. (de Luzuriaga / Ma / Seumanutafa)
key_work.brief_description: Deceptively simple, Mo’Ju’s ‘Native Tongue’ it uses a single shot of the singer and three Djuki Mala dancers walking through an unmistakably Australian landscape. The glitch effect utilised not only adds visual emphasis to the on-screen movement, but also underlines the poignant lyrics.

constellations_primary.name: Native Tongue

end.title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople
end.creator_credit: Kristin Seth, Carthew Neal, Leanne Saunders, Matt Noonan and Taika Waititi
end.brief_description: Ricky is a defiant young city kid who finds himself on the run with his cantankerous foster uncle in the wild New Zealand bush. A national manhunt ensues, and the two are forced to put aside their differences and work together to survive.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

links.description: For his song ‘New Takeover’, Stan Walker paid tribute to his Māori heritage and featured dancers from the Hawaiki TŪ theatre in the music video. Walker has also appeared in several films, including Taika Waititi’s Hunt For The Wilderpeople.

end.title: The Strange Chores
end.brief_description: The show centers around two teenage warrior-heroes and a spirited ghost girl who master the skills they need to replace an ageing monster-slayer by doing his supernatural chores.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

links.description: Written, directed, producer and starring Taika Waititi, Hunt For The Wilderpeople featured a breakout performance from Māori actor Julian Dennison who also voices a character in The Strange Chores.

start.title: The Strange Chores
start.brief_description: The show centers around two teenage warrior-heroes and a spirited ghost girl who master the skills they need to replace an ageing monster-slayer by doing his supernatural chores.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

end.title: Bluey
end.brief_description: Bluey is an inexhaustible six year-old Blue Heeler dog, who loves to play and turns everyday family life into extraordinary adventures, developing her imagination as well as her mental, physical and emotional resilience.

constellations_other.name: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls
constellations_other.description: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls explores the reality of living in Mparntwe (Alice Springs) through the eyes of the artists, who grew up there. Place and Indigenous representation are also vital to the other works in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

links.description: Landing a number of Hollywood roles while he was still just a teenager, Julian Dennison brought the character of Pierce to life in The Strange Chores. The supernatural animated series comes from two of the producers of Bluey.

start.title: Bluey

end.title: Robbie Hood (2019)
end.brief_description: TV series that follows the exploits of Robbie Hood as he steals from the rich and gives to the poor.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

links.description: Bluey is set in Brisbane, Australia and follows the adventures of a family of Blue Heelers. It became a global children’s TV phenomenon since it debuted and is executive produced by Daley Pearson who was also behind Robbie Hood.

start.title: Robbie Hood (2019)
start.brief_description: TV series that follows the exploits of Robbie Hood as he steals from the rich and gives to the poor.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

end.title: Sweet Country
end.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Heather Wallace, David Jowsey, Greer Simpkin, Bunya Productions, Tony Cronin, David Tranter and Steven McGregor
end.brief_description: It’s 1929 on the vast, desert-like, Eastern Arrernte Nation lands that are now known as the Central Australian outback. Sam Kelly, a middle-aged Aboriginal man, works the land of a kind preacher, Fred Smith. After an ill-tempered bully arrives in town and Kelly kills him in self-defence, he and his wife go on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

constellations_primary.name: Sweet Country
constellations_primary.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

constellations_other.name: David Dalaithngu
constellations_other.description: David Dalaithngu was a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

links.description: Set in Alice Springs, Robbie Hood plays on Robin Hood’s central premise of stealing from the rich to give to the poor as it follows the adventures of an Indigenous teenager. The series is directed and co-written by Dylan River, who worked on Sweet Country.

start.title: Sweet Country
start.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Heather Wallace, David Jowsey, Greer Simpkin, Bunya Productions, Tony Cronin, David Tranter and Steven McGregor

Sam Kelly, a middle-aged Aboriginal man, works the land of a kind preacher, Fred Smith. After an ill-tempered bully arrives in town and Kelly kills him in self-defence, he and his wife go on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

As a young boy, Dalaithngu was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

end.title: Mystery Road
end.brief_description: When there is a mysterious disappearance on an outback cattle station, Detective Jay Swan is assigned to investigate. Working with local cop Emma James, Jay’s investigation uncovers a past injustice that threatens the fabric of the whole community.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

links.description: Serving as second unit director on Sweet Country was a family affair for Dylan River, whose father Warwick Thornton directed the Australian classic. They also both worked on the Mystery Road TV series.

start.title: Native Tongue – Mo’Ju
start.credit_line: ℗ 2018 Mojo Juju, exclusively licensed to Australian Broadcasting Corporation. (de Luzuriaga / Ma / Seumanutafa)
start.brief_description: Deceptively simple, Mo’Ju’s ‘Native Tongue’ it uses a single shot of the singer and three Djuki Mala dancers walking through an unmistakably Australian landscape. The glitch effect utilised not only adds visual emphasis to the on-screen movement, but also underlines the poignant lyrics.

end.title: New Takeover (2017)
end.brief_description: Music video for Stan Walker’s song New Takeover.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

links.description: The video clip for ‘Native Tongue’ (2018) – like Mo’Ju herself – incorporated the artistic practice of a myriad of different cultures, including vocals from the Pasefika Vitoria Choir. Stan Walker paid homage to his culture in ‘New Takeover’ (2017).
